tables.name: COMPANY
tables.description: Stores records for both high-level business units ('Operating Units') and their specific 'Inventory Organizations' (e.g., warehouses, offices). CRITICAL WARNING: This is a denormalized table where multiple Inventory Organizations (identified by ORGANIZATION_ID_1 and ORGANIZATION_NAME) can belong to a single Operating Unit (identified by ORGANIZATION_ID). Aggregating financial data using the wrong ID will lead to severely incorrect and duplicated results.
critical_joins: Joins to ORDERS on COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1 = ORDERS.SHIP_FROM_ORG_ID to analyze performance by the specific warehouse/division that fulfilled an order.
Joins to ITEM on COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1 = ITEM.ORGANIZATION_ID to link a warehouse to its item master.
Joins to CUSTOMER on COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID = CUSTOMER.ORG_ID_1.
Joins to SUBINVENTORY on COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1 = SUBINVENTORY.ORGANIZATION_ID.

RULES.condition: When a query requires revenue, profit, or quantity summed by a specific division or organization name.
RULES.instruction: You MUST join using COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1 to ORDERS.SHIP_FROM_ORG_ID and use the COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_NAME for grouping.

columns.name: BUSINESS_GROUP_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the business group the organization belongs to.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the high-level business unit ('Operating Unit').DO NOT USE THIS ID for calculating revenue by division. Use ORGANIZATION_ID_1 instead.

columns.name: NAME
columns.description: The legal name of the company or high-level business unit.

columns.name: DATE_FROM
columns.description: The date from which the organization is active.

columns.name: SHORT_CODE
columns.description: An abbreviated name or code for the organization.

columns.name: SET_OF_BOOKS_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the set of accounting books used.

columns.name: DEFAULT_LEGAL_CONTEXT_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the default legal entity context.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_ID_1
columns.description: The primary key representing a physical 'Inventory Organization' (e.g., a warehouse or division). CRITICAL: This is the correct ID to use when calculating revenue or performance for a specific, individual division. It should be joined to ORDERS.SHIP_FROM_ORG_ID.

columns.name: BUSINESS_GROUP_ID_1
columns.description: Redundant identifier for the business group, associated with the inventory organization.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_CODE
columns.description: A short code for the inventory organization.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_NAME
columns.description: The full name of a specific inventory organization (e.g., 'QQP - Consumer - Inventory' warehouse). Use this for grouping after joining on ORGANIZATION_ID_1.

columns.name: SET_OF_BOOKS_ID_1
columns.description: Redundant identifier for the set of accounting books, associated with the inventory organization.

columns.name: CHART_OF_ACCOUNTS_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the chart of accounts used by the organization.

columns.name: OPERATING_UNIT
columns.description: The operating unit associated with the inventory organization.

columns.name: LEGAL_ENTITY
columns.description: The legal entity associated with the inventory organization.

tables.name: CUSTOMERS
tables.description: A denormalized table containing customer account, party, and site information.
critical_joins: Joins to ORDERS on CUSTOMERS.CUST_ACCOUNT_ID = ORDERS.SOLD_TO_ORG_ID.
Joins to COMPANY on CUSTOMERS.ORG_ID_1 = COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID.

columns.name: CUST_ACCOUNT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for a customer's financial account.

columns.name: PARTY_ID
columns.description: A unique identifier for the customer entity (the 'party').

columns.name: LAST_UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Timestamp of the most recent update to the customer account.

columns.name: ACCOUNT_NUMBER
columns.description: The customer's account number.

columns.name: STATUS
columns.description: Status of the customer account (e.g., 'A' for Active and 'I' for inactive).

columns.name: CUSTOMER_TYPE
columns.description: Type of customer (e.g., 'R' for Retail).

columns.name: ACCOUNT_NAME
columns.description: The name of the customer's account.

columns.name: CUST_ACCT_SITE_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the customer's account site.

columns.name: PARTY_SITE_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the party's physical site or address.

columns.name: LAST_UPDATE_DATE_1
columns.description: Timestamp of the most recent update to the party site.

columns.name: CREATION_DATE_1
columns.description: Timestamp of the party site's creation.

columns.name: STATUS_1
columns.description: Status of the customer account site.

columns.name: ORG_ID_1
columns.description: Foreign key linking to the ORGANIZATION_ID in the COMPANY table.

columns.name: LOCATION_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the physical location of the customer site.

columns.name: STATUS_2
columns.description: Status of the party site.

columns.name: PARTY_SITE_NAME
columns.description: The name of the party site, often including a location descriptor.

tables.name: ITEM_AGENCY
critical_joins: Joins to MTL_CATS on ITEM_AGENCY.FLEX_VALUE = MTL_CATS.SEGMENT1

columns.name: FLEX_VALUE
columns.description: The unique identifier for the item agency.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The name of the item agency.

tables.name: ITEM_BRAND
critical_joins: Joins to MTL_CATS on ITEM_BRAND.FLEX_VALUE = MTL_CATS.SEGMENT5

columns.name: FLEX_VALUE
columns.description: The unique identifier for the item brand.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The name of the item brand.

tables.name: ITEM_CATEGORY
critical_joins: Joins to MTL_CATS on ITEM_CATEGORY.FLEX_VALUE = MTL_CATS.SEGMENT3

columns.name: FLEX_VALUE
columns.description: The unique identifier for the item category.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The name of the item category.

tables.name: ITEM
tables.description: Stores the master list of all products (items) that can be sold or stored in inventory.
critical_joins: Joins to ORDERS on ITEM.INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = ORDERS.INVENTORY_ITEM_ID.
Joins to MTL_CATS on ITEM.INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = MTL_CATS.INVENTORY_ITEM_ID and ITEM.ORGANIZATION_ID = MTL_CATS.ORGANIZATION_ID for secondary/all category assignments.
Joins to COMPANY on ITEM.ORGANIZATION_ID = COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1.

columns.name: INVENTORY_ITEM_ID
columns.description: A unique identifier for each item.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1.

columns.name: LAST_UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Timestamp of the most recent update.

columns.name: CREATION_DATE
columns.description: Timestamp of record creation.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: A detailed description of the item.

columns.name: SEGMENT1
columns.description: The item's code or part number.

columns.name: ALLOWED_UNITS_LOOKUP_CODE
columns.description: A code for the allowed units of measure.

columns.name: SALES_ACCOUNT
columns.description: Identifier for the sales account associated with the item.

columns.name: ITEM_TYPE
columns.description: The type of the item (e.g., 'FOOD', 'NON FOOD').

columns.name: PrimaryAgencyID
columns.description: The item's primary agency for financial reporting. Foreign key to ITEM_AGENCY.FLEX_VALUE.

columns.name: PrimaryCategoryID
columns.description: The item's primary category for financial reporting. Foreign key to ITEM_CATEGORY.FLEX_VALUE.

columns.name: PrimaryBrandID
columns.description: The item's primary brand for financial reporting. Foreign key to ITEM_BRAND.FLEX_VALUE.

tables.name: MTL_CATS
tables.description: This table links items to their respective categories, brands, and agencies.
critical_joins: Joins to ITEM on MTL_CATS.INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = ITEM.INVENTORY_ITEM_ID and MTL_CATS.ORGANIZATION_ID = ITEM.ORGANIZATION_ID.
Joins to ITEM_AGENCY on MTL_CATS.SEGMENT1 = ITEM_AGENCY.FLEX_VALUE.
Joins to ITEM_CATEGORY on MTL_CATS.SEGMENT3 = ITEM_CATEGORY.FLEX_VALUE.
Joins to ITEM_BRAND on MTL_CATS.SEGMENT5 = ITEM_BRAND.FLEX_VALUE.

columns.name: INVENTORY_ITEM_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to the ITEM table.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to the ITEM table.

columns.name: CATEGORY_SET_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the category set being used.

columns.name: CATEGORY_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the category.

columns.name: LAST_UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Timestamp of the most recent update.

columns.name: CREATION_DATE
columns.description: Timestamp of record creation.

columns.name: CATEGORY_ID_1
columns.description: A redundant identifier for the category.

columns.name: SEGMENT1
columns.description: Foreign key to ITEM_AGENCY.FLEX_VALUE.

columns.name: SEGMENT3
columns.description: Foreign key to ITEM_CATEGORY.FLEX_VALUE.

columns.name: SEGMENT5
columns.description: Foreign key to ITEM_BRAND.FLEX_VALUE.

tables.name: ORDERS
tables.description: Contains denormalized sales order header and line item details, one
critical_joins: The only valid path from ORDERS to ITEM_AGENCY, ITEM_BRAND, or ITEM_CATEGORY is through the ITEM and MTL_CATS tables in sequence. Direct joins are not possible.
Joins to COMPANY on ORDERS.ORG_ID = COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID.
Joins to COMPANY on ORDERS.SHIP_FROM_ORG_ID = COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1.
Joins to CUSTOMERS on ORDERS.SOLD_TO_ORG_ID = CUSTOMERS.CUST_ACCOUNT_ID.
Joins to SUBINVENTORY on ORDERS.SUBINVENTORY = SUBINVENTORY.SECONDARY_INVENTORY_NAME.
Joins to SALESPERSONS on ORDERS.SALESREP_ID = SALESPERSONS.SALESREP_ID.

RULES.condition: When a query requires BOTH a SUM of revenue from ORDERS AND a JOIN to MTL_CATS (for agency, brand, or category details).
RULES.instruction: To prevent severe revenue inflation, you MUST pre-aggregate the revenue from the ORDERS table in a separate, initial query step. The subsequent query can then join this pre-aggregated result to ITEM and MTL_CATS.
RULES.consequence_of_failure: The final revenue numbers will be severely inflated and incorrect.

columns.name: HEADER_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the order header,this value can be duplicated as each order can contain many different orders

columns.name: ORG_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID.

columns.name: ORDER_TYPE_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the type of order.

columns.name: ORDER_NUMBER
columns.description: The unique number for the sales order.

columns.name: ORDERED_DATE
columns.description: The date the order was placed.

columns.name: PRICE_LIST_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the price list used.

columns.name: SOLD_TO_ORG_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to CUSTOMERS.CUST_ACCOUNT_ID.

columns.name: SHIP_FROM_ORG_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1.

columns.name: SALESREP_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to the SALESPERSONS table.

columns.name: LINE_ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for the order line.

columns.name: ORDERED_ITEM
columns.description: The item code that was ordered.

columns.name: ORDERED_QUANTITY
columns.description: The quantity of the item ordered.

columns.name: INVENTORY_ITEM_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to the ITEM table.

columns.name: UNIT_SELLING_PRICE
columns.description: The per-unit price at which the item was sold.
business_rules: Total revenue for a line item is calculated as ORDERED_QUANTITY * UNIT_SELLING_PRICE.

columns.name: UNIT_LIST_PRICE
columns.description: The listed per-unit price of the item.

columns.name: SUBINVENTORY
columns.description: The subinventory from which the item was shipped.

tables.name: SALESPERSONS
critical_joins: Joins to ORDERS on SALESPERSONS.SALESREP_ID = ORDERS.SALESREP_ID.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to the COMPANY table.

columns.name: SALESREP_ID
columns.description: Unique identifier for the salesperson.

columns.name: USERCODE
columns.description: The user code of the salesperson.

columns.name: EMPLOYEENUMBER
columns.description: The employee number of the salesperson.

columns.name: USERNAME
columns.description: The full name of the salesperson.

columns.name: USERALTNAME
columns.description: An alternative name for the salesperson.

columns.name: USERPHONE
columns.description: The salesperson's phone number.

columns.name: USERADDRESS
columns.description: The salesperson's address.

columns.name: USEREMAIL
columns.description: The salesperson's email address.

tables.name: SUBINVENTORY
tables.description: Stores information about subinventories, which are subdivisions of inventory organizations.
critical_joins: Joins to ORDERS on SUBINVENTORY.SECONDARY_INVENTORY_NAME = ORDERS.SUBINVENTORY.
Joins to COMPANY on SUBINVENTORY.ORGANIZATION_ID = COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1.

columns.name: SECONDARY_INVENTORY_NAME
columns.description: The unique name of the subinventory.

columns.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
columns.description: Foreign key to COMPANY.ORGANIZATION_ID_1.

columns.name: LAST_UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Timestamp of the most recent update.

columns.name: CREATION_DATE
columns.description: Timestamp of record creation.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: A description of the subinventory.

columns.name: ASSET_INVENTORY
columns.description: Flag indicating if it is an asset inventory.

columns.name: STATUS_ID
columns.description: Identifier for the status of the subinventory.

columns.name: SUBINVENTORY_TYPE
columns.description: The type of subinventory.
